intro: Ricinocarpus costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican ricinocarp, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain seeds with a distinctive, angular shape. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
